g.text: shows that formedpolarization gratings have a non-harmonic character with a
pronounced predominance of even harmonics. The predominance of even harmonics (in particular the
second one) in the structure of polarization gratings can be mathematically explained by the presence
in Expressions (16, 17), which causes the inﬂuence of squares cos
on tensor perturbation. Physically, this e
ect can be explained by the symmetry of
the LC molecules with respect to the axis of their rotation. Therefore, the change in dielectric constant
when the molecule is rotated by a positive angle will be similar to the change when it is rotated to
a negative angle, and thus, the period of
change doubles. Additionally, doubled period of
polarization gratings in PDLC is shown experimentally in [
Additionally, it can be seen that recording by two waves with orthogonal circular polarization
leads to the formation of polarization grating with a more pronounced harmonic character compared to
the structure recorded with linear orthogonal polarized waves, since in this case there is no modulation
of ellipticity. However, in this case, even harmonics also make the main contribution.
Analysis of formation of polarization gratings in PDLC shows e
ects similar to formation in PSLC
with smoothly decreasing character of amplitudes of even harmonics’ behaviour.
show that when intensity of the recording ﬁeld exceeding the critical value
), the perturbation of the dielectric tensor caused by the phase grating formation can be
commensurate with the perturbation caused by the polarization grating formation in the same sample.
ect will be especially vivid in the case of polarization states of recording beams that are close
To conﬁrmthis conclusion, a quantitative estimate of the second harmonic’s amplitude was made
by expression (33), based on the following conditions: Average refractive index of the composition
the second harmonic of the refractive index
In this case, the amplitude of the second harmonic of the polarization grating (see Figure
0.1. The evaluation shows the validity of the conclusion about the proportionality of
the contributions of the two mechanisms in the formation of di
In this paper we developed an analytical model for the HDS formation in PSLC and PDLC,
which takes into account an arbitrary polarization state of recording beams. The forms of spatial
proﬁles of perturbations of the dielectric tensor are numerically investigated. It is shown that the
main contribution to the perturbation of the dielectric tensor of a material when only the polarization
mechanism is taken into account is made by even spatial harmonics of changes in the dielectric
It is shown that the perturbation of the dielectric permittivity in the process of recording of
polarization gratings is comparable in magnitude with the perturbation caused by recording phase
gratings in this material. It suggests the need to take into account the polarization mechanismduring
holographic recording by arbitrarily polarized beams.
Conceptualization and methodology, S.S.; software, investigation and visualization, A.S.;
writing–original draft preparation, A.S.; writing–review and editing, S.S.
The work is performed as a project part of Government Task of Russian Ministry of Education
The authors declare no conﬂict of interest.
1. Close, D.H.; Jacobson, A.D.; Margerum, J.D.; Brault, R.G.; McClung, F.J. Hologramrecordingonphotopolymer
2. Jenney, J.A. Holographic Recording with Photopolymers.
